parts:
Here’s a hard-nosed audit of **sgmathtuition.microsite.sg** (as it is today) and what I’d change before you spend on ads for the **Oct 2025 → Feb 2026** push.

# What’s working
- **Clear value prop in the hero** (Secondary & JC maths; personalised tutoring). The WhatsApp callout is present and clickable (+65 9299 7306). citeturn1view0
- **Strong tutor credibility** (NUS PhD, SUSS faculty, note on conflict-of-interest). citeturn1view0

# Critical issues (hurting Quality Score, conversions, and compliance)
1) **Form is obviously a placeholder**  
   It’s labeled “Contact Form Demo,” includes a field literally called “Numeric Field,” and repeats again at the bottom—this reads like a staged template, not a production lead form. Expect poor trust and conversion. citeturn1view0

2) **Duplicate sections / filler**  
   “So, I created an effective approach…” and the three “Solution” blocks appear twice, almost verbatim—bloats the page and dilutes message match. citeturn1view0

3) **Lack of required transparency for ad destinations**  
   I can’t see any **Privacy/PDPA notice**, data-collection purpose, or consent language near the form. That’s a red flag under Singapore’s PDPA (Consent, Purpose Limitation obligations) and also weakens landing-page trust for Google Ads’ destination policies. citeturn6view0turn6view1turn8search0turn7search2

4) **Thin local signals**  
   No areas served, no neighbourhoods, no operating hours, no address (even if you’re home/online-only, you can state “Online | across Singapore” and typical lesson times). This hurts perceived relevance for “near me”/location intents.

5) **Stocky visuals + weak alt text**  
   Images are generic (“Image”, “SG 1/2/3”), which neither build trust nor help accessibility/SEO. citeturn1view0

6) **Brand/ownership clarity**  
   Footer shows “Powered by MediaOne.” That’s fine, but ensure the advertiser identity in Google Ads matches the entity collecting the leads (your sole-prop or company), per 2025 Ads transparency. citeturn3view0turn7search1

---

# High-impact fixes (do these first)
**A. Fix the conversion stack (forms & calls)**
- Replace the demo form with: **Parent/Student Name**, **Contact (mobile)**, **Student Level** (Sec 3/4 E/A, JC1 H1/H2, JC2 H2/H3), **Preferred mode** (In-person/Online), **Message**.  
- Add **PDPA consent** checkbox + link to a **Data Protection Notice** stating purposes (lesson scheduling, follow-up), retention, and DPO contact. Place this **immediately above the submit**. (PDPA consent & purpose obligations). citeturn7search2
- Add a **tel:** click-to-call button (keep WA, but calls convert differently).  
- Send form submits to a **dedicated “Thank You” page** and fire **Google Ads conversion** on that page; also track WhatsApp clicks and phone clicks as separate conversions. (Destination requirements & conversion best practices.) citeturn8search0turn8search14turn8search10

**B. Tighten the message & layout for landing-page experience**
- Keep one set of the “Challenge → Solution → 4-Step Process”. Remove the duplicate block. citeturn1view0
- Rework the hero to match search intent exactly:  
  “**H2 / A-Math & H1/H2 JC Math Tuition in Singapore** — 1-to-1 & Small Groups. Limited slots Oct–Feb.”  
  Google emphasises relevance, easy navigation, and transparency on destinations in 2025—trim fluff, surface key info above the fold. citeturn8search20
- Add **local relevance** (“Online island-wide | In-person: Bukit Timah • Clementi • Bishan …”) and **operating hours**.

**C. Compliance & trust**
- Footer: **business name/UEN**, **Data Protection Notice**, **Contact methods**, and (if applicable) **Terms**. PDPA obligations apply when collecting personal data in SG. citeturn7search0turn7search2
- Testimonials: add **school level & year** and a simple **results disclaimer** (outcomes vary)—helps avoid “unverifiable claims” issues under Ads policies while keeping social proof. citeturn8search0

**D. Tracking that actually works**
- Use **GTM** to send: form submit (thank-you page), tel clicks, WA clicks, and (optionally) **call duration** conversions (≥60 s). Consider **server-side** conversion tracking if you’re comfortable; improves resilience to ITP/ad blockers. citeturn8search12

**E. Brand & domain**
- If possible, map the microsite to a subdomain of your brand (e.g., **apply.sgmathtuition.com**) via CNAME for trust/continuity. Ensure the **advertiser verification** name (in Google Ads) matches the entity on the landing page (2025 transparency). citeturn7search1

---

# “Good-to-great” enhancements (next 1–2 weeks)
- **Real photos** (teaching setup, whiteboard snippets, anonymised student work), not stock. Replace “Image/SG1/2/3” with descriptive **alt**. citeturn1view0  
- **Structured data (JSON-LD)** to help SERP and ad systems understand the offer. For a tutor, a simple **LocalBusiness** (or **EducationalOrganization**) is fine. Include `name`, `areaServed` (“Singapore”), `offers` (“1-to-1, small group”), `telephone`, `sameAs` (site/social), and `knowsAbout` (E-Math, A-Math, H1/H2/H3).  
- **Sitelink-ready sections** for Ads: *Rates & Schedule*, *Free Diagnostic Lesson*, *Testimonials*, *FAQs*. (Improves ad extensions & navigation). citeturn8search3

---

# Campaign plan for **Oct 2025 → Feb 2026** (search + remarketing)
**Assumption:** you’re targeting Oct–Nov exam crunch (O/A-Levels), Dec holiday bridging, Jan–Feb new-year intake.

**1) Search campaigns (exact/broad-match mix with RSAs)**
- **Ad groups** (tight themes):  
  - *JC H2 Math Tuition*, *JC H1/H3 Math Tuition*  
  - *Sec 3/4 A-Math Tuition*, *Sec 3/4 E-Math Tuition*  
  - *IP Math Tuition*, *Online Math Tuition Singapore*  
- **Headlines to test:** “H2 Math Tutor (PhD, NUS)”, “A-Math Small Group — Limited Oct Slots”, “1-to-1 JC Math — Free Diagnostic”, “Online Tuition, Island-wide (JC & Sec)”.  
- **Assets:** sitelinks (Rates, Schedule, Free Diagnostic, Testimonials), callouts (1-to-1, Small Group, 16+ years), structured snippets (Levels: Sec 3/4, JC1/2). Keep copy consistent with the landing page—this is now weighted more in 2025 quality calculations. citeturn8search20

**2) Performance Max / Display remarketing**
- Feedless PMax with image/video assets (short tutor intro, whiteboard clips), excluding broad placement where needed. Use as **catch-all remarketing** to mop up non-converters from Search.

**3) Bidding & budgets**
- Start with **tCPA or Max Conversions** (with realistic initial CPA), then graduate to **tROAS** once you have enough conversion value signals (e.g., weighting JC vs Sec enquiries).

**4) Measurement**
- Separate conversion actions for **Form submit**, **Phone call (≥60s)**, **WhatsApp click**; assign values to prioritise the ones that lead to paid enrolments. (Thank-you-page triggers for form; event tags for clicks.) citeturn8search21turn8search10

---

# Minimal schema starter (drop in `<script type="application/ld+json">` on the page)
```json
{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "LocalBusiness",
  "name": "SG Maths Tuition",
  "url": "https://sgmathtuition.microsite.sg/",
  "telephone": "+65-92997306",
  "areaServed": "Singapore",
  "description": "1-to-1 and small-group E-Math, A-Math, and JC H1/H2/H3 Mathematics tuition.",
  "offers": [
    {"@type": "Offer", "name": "1-to-1 Tuition"},
    {"@type": "Offer", "name": "Small-Group Tuition"},
    {"@type": "Offer", "name": "Online Tuition"}
  ],
  "knowsAbout": ["A-Math", "E-Math", "H1 Math", "H2 Math", "H3 Math", "IP Math"]
}
```

---

# Concrete to-do checklist
- Replace demo form; add **PDPA consent** + **Data Protection Notice** link in footer and near the form. citeturn7search2  
- Remove duplicated sections; keep one clean **Challenge → Solution → Process** flow. citeturn1view0  
- Add **tel:** CTA, **Thank-You** page, and wire up **GTM + Google Ads conversions** (form, tel, WA). citeturn8search10turn8search14  
- Add **local signals** (areas served, hours) and upgrade testimonials with context + disclaimer. citeturn8search0  
- Consider mapping to **apply.sgmathtuition.com** (or similar) and complete **advertiser verification** with the same entity name you show on the page. citeturn7search1  
- Add **schema** and replace stock visuals with authentic images + proper alt text. citeturn1view0

If you want, I can draft the exact **PDPA notice text**, the **final form markup (with validation + GTM dataLayer pushes)**, and the **GTM container recipe** so your team can import and publish without guesswork.

{"name":"Microsite-Clone-Content-v0.1.html","type":"code/html","content":" SG Maths Tuition — Landing Copy (Clone, No Header/Footer/Forms)

JC & Secondary Maths Tuition — Singapore

Ace A‑Math, E‑Math, and JC H1/H2/H3 with Personalised Tutoring

Excel in Mathematics with Dr Ng (Ph.D., NUS). 1‑to‑1 and small‑group lessons aligned to the latest MOE syllabus, with targeted support for IP and IB tracks. 16+ years of teaching; proven frameworks for conceptual mastery and exam performance.

WhatsApp: +65 9299 7306 Call Email

No forms on this copy by request. Use the buttons above for contact in this preview.

Secondary School

  • E‑Math (Sec 3/4, IP)
  • A‑Math (Sec 3/4, IP)
  • Topical remediation • exam strategy • coursework planning

Junior College

  • H1 Mathematics
  • H2 Mathematics
  • H3 / Further Mathematics
  • Conceptual depth • proofs where useful • timed practice

Meet Your Tutor, Dr Ng

I am a full‑time private tutor with a Ph.D. in Mathematics (National University of Singapore, First Class Honours at B.Sc.). I have taught since 2002, helping Upper Secondary and JC students build durable understanding and exam confidence. My approach blends deep subject expertise with diagnostics that identify the exact gaps holding a student back, then resolves them systematically.

Qualifications

  • Ph.D. (Mathematics), NUS
  • B.Sc. (First Class Honours), NUS
  • Associate Faculty, SUSS

Experience

  • 16+ years teaching; full‑time private tutor
  • Centres and home‑based; online and in‑person
  • Well‑versed with latest MOE syllabus (IP / IB exposure)

Location

Near Kovan MRT • Online, island‑wide.

[REVIEW] “More than 80% of students improved by ≥2 grades within a few months” — include only if you have records to substantiate.

Professional integrity: I do not accept my own SUSS students for paid private tuition to avoid conflicts of interest.

Why Strong Students Still Struggle

1) Fragile foundations

Small gaps in algebra, functions, or calculus snowball into confusion as topics compound.

2) One‑size‑fits‑all lessons

Mass lectures and generic tips rarely match an individual’s pacing and misconceptions.

3) Exam pressure

Stress inhibits recall and reasoning; without a plan, timed sections become guesswork.

The Approach That Fixes It

Expert guidance

Deep subject mastery and clear explanations aligned with MOE expectations.

Personalised plan

We diagnose, then target the exact misconceptions holding you back.

Supportive pace

Confident learning environment with the right mix of stretch and support.

Your Path to Mastery (4 Steps)

  1. Discovery: Diagnostic review of recent scripts to map strengths and gaps.
  2. Custom Lessons: Focused sessions to rebuild concepts and methods.
  3. Guided Mastery: Worked examples → independent practice → timed drills.
  4. Lock‑in: Spaced review, error logs, and exam rehearsal to retain and perform.

What Students Say

  • “My Math grade improved tremendously after starting tuition with Mr Ng… now I’m scoring As and Bs.” — Chui Si Min [REVIEW: verify consent/wording]
  • “Very clear explanations; ideal for students weak in fundamentals like me.” — Vivienne Tay [REVIEW]
  • “Objective‑oriented sessions; difficult problems were explained and solved skillfully.” — Dalon Lee [REVIEW]

[REVIEW] Add level/year context if available (e.g., JC2 H2, 2024). Consider a results disclaimer: outcomes vary by student.

FAQs

Do you offer online lessons?

Yes. Online lessons use tablet/whiteboard workflows and exam‑style question banks. In‑person options available near Kovan. [REVIEW: adjust locations]

How are lessons structured?

Diagnostics → targeted teaching → guided practice → timed rehearsal. Homework and error logs reinforce retention.

Which levels and syllabi?

Sec 3/4 (E‑Math, A‑Math, IP), JC1/2 (H1/H2/H3/Further). Familiar with current MOE requirements; exposure to IB.

Rates & scheduling?

[REVIEW] Insert your current rates and typical lesson times here, or keep this section for sitelink-only.

Ready to Improve Grades & Confidence?

Limited slots Oct–Feb. Reach out now to secure a suitable timeslot.

WhatsApp: +65 9299 7306 Call Email

[REVIEW] Add any enrolment window notes (e.g., free diagnostic, trial lesson) compliant with Ads policy.

"}

Upper-Sec (E/A-Math), JC (H1/H2/H3 & Further Math), and Uni Y1–Y2 (Calculus, Linear Algebra, Probability/Statistics, Analysis, Discrete) — each with level-specific targets and milestones.

Diagnostic & Goal-Setting

Coached problem-solving with immediate step-level feedback. Errors are logged; alternative approaches are compared; speed and accuracy are calibrated.
